Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

The left end of a spring is fixed to a wall and the right end is initially at rest at position <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </math>. The spring constant of the spring is <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>. Two identical blocks <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> of total mass <math alttext="2m" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math> are sliding together across a horizontal surface towards the spring with initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Friction between the surface and the blocks is negligible, and the two blocks are not attached to each other.

At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> (not shown), the blocks reach the right end of the spring, and Block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> attaches to the spring.

At time <math alttext="t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> the blocks momentarily come to rest and the right end of the spring is at position <math alttext="x equals negative x sub maximum" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

At time <math alttext="t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> the blocks are moving to the right, but the right end of the spring has not yet returned to position <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>.

At time <math alttext="t sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> (not shown), the right end of the spring, with Block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> attached, again reaches <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

At time <math alttext="t sub 4" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math> (not shown), the spring reaches its maximum extension and Block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is momentarily at rest.
